astar_t wrote:
>
> Hi I have set my canonicalization rules to strip SIDs for tracking
> already seen URLs and it is in enabled in the crawl job's expert
> settings. However, when I look at the crawl.log there are a bunch of
> duplicates (all the same file size) where the URL is exactly the same
> except for sid=nnnnn at the end of the query string.
>
> I also tried pausing the crawl and adding an additional Regex rule
> but to no avail. Any idea why this is happening? I am using
> Heritrix v1.10.0.
>
> Any help appreciated. This crawl has been runnig hours and hours due
> to this sid loop.
>











The default session ID canonicalization rule strips SIDs that are 32 
characters long (See 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/url/canonicalize/StripSessionIDs.html#56).   
Your SID values below are only 5 digits.  Try adding a new regex 
canonicalization rule to weed out 5-digit SIDs that appear at the end of 
the URL.

Doing the above will prevent further queuing of 5-digit SID URLs but it 
won't have any effect on problem URLs already queued.   For the 
already-queued, consider adding an exclusion rule to the scope crafted 
to trigger on 5-digit SIDS and enable 'recheck-scope' on the Preselector 
processor.

St.Ack
